page.title: 12Housing in Pontycymer
page.content: Because of the narrow valley bottom Pontycymer is a linear, ribbon settlement, expanding lengthways along the valley floor. The town and houses were built between 1880 and 1912. Before this the area was all rural. With the building of the collieries town and houses the area became industrial though now it is said to be semi-rural and is becoming important as a residential area. The houses were built to cater for the mineworkers and were owned by the colliery owners. The houses are nearly all typical working class; two or three storeys, small, and built in terraces on the hillsides for economy, they are built of locally quarried materials slate, sandstone, brick . With the increase in population of from 1880-1925's trades and shops grew up to cater for the mineworkers.
